function.bubble:
A function is a reusable piece of code.

Algorithms and programs are ultimately a series of instructions that you write for the computer to follow, much the same way a recipe is a series of instructions for a cook to follow. When your algorithmic recipe requires repeating similar sets of instructions at different points in your program, it can be useful to encapsulate that sub-set of instructions into it's own module, creating a function is one way of doing that.

A pastry recipe might require grabbing a whisk, placing in the bowl and rotating it for some number of seconds, at different points. So it might be helpful to abstract those steps into a "stir" function.
